de.tuberlin.dima.bdapro.dataIntegration.weather

Class WeatherWorkflow

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tuberlin.dima.bdapro.dataIntegration.weather.WeatherWorkflow

  • public class WeatherWorkflow
extends java.lang.Object
    This class materialize the weather input data from OpenWeatherMap web APIs and creates a new FeatureTable containing the requested fields previously defined in the logic of the WeatherReading class.

      Creates a new FeatureTable from the weather input data
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      Creates a new WeatherReading DataSet from the csv input weather data from OpenWeatherMap web APIs and the requested weather fields defined in the logic of the WeatherReading class.

      • generateFeatureTable

        public static FeatureTable generateFeatureTable(java.lang.String dataDirectory,
                                                org.apache.flink.api.java.ExecutionEnvironment env,
                                                org.apache.flink.table.api.java.BatchTableEnvironment batchTableEnvironment)
        Creates a new FeatureTable from the weather input data
        Parameters:
        env - the Flink execution environment
        batchTableEnvironment - the Flink batch table environment
        Returns:
        a FeatureTable containing the requested fields previously defined in the logic of the WeatherReading class.

      • readWeather

        private static org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<WeatherReading> readWeather(org.apache.flink.api.java.ExecutionEnvironment env,
                                                                             java.lang.String weatherDataPath,
                                                                             java.util.List<Field> fields)
        Creates a new WeatherReading DataSet from the csv input weather data from OpenWeatherMap web APIs and the requested weather fields defined in the logic of the WeatherReading class.
        Parameters:
        env - the Flink execution environment
        weatherDataPath - a valid Path containing the csv input weather data from OpenWeatherMap web APIs
        fields - a List containing the requested fields defined in the logic of the WeatherReading class.
        Returns:
        a DataSet with the requested weather fields defined in the logic of the WeatherReading class.
